action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
X X X X X
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X
X X X X X
DESCRIPTION: The grid is a 5x5 square. The outermost cells form a border of X's, and the inner 3x3 area consists of empty squares (▢).

Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:

DESCRIPTION: The grid is 5x5. It has an "X" pattern forming a cross, with the center and all four edges marked by "X". The rest of the cells are empty ("▢"). The "X" cells form a symmetrical cross shape.

This is my DESCRIPTION: The grid is a 5x5 square. The outermost cells form a border of X's, and the inner 3x3 area consists of empty squares (▢).
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are the cells in the four corners of your grid marked with "X"?

QUESTION: Are the cells in the four corners of your grid marked with "X"? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are the cells in the middle of each edge (not including corners) marked with "X"?

ANSWER: Yes.

QUESTION: Are all the cells in the border of your grid marked with "X"?

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are the cells in the second row and second column (not including the border) empty ("▢")?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Are the cells in the second row and second column (not including the border) empty ("▢")? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your grid and the other grid described the same?  Write "DECISION: same grid" if you think they are the same grid or "DECISION: different grids" if you think they are different grids. Do not add anything else.
